page.title: 07Family Size in Our Area.
page.content: Our aim was to find out the number of children per family. We went round the classes and got all the children to say how many brothers and sisters they have in their families. In class one they have thirty-three brothers and thirty-two sisters. In class two they have forty-four brothers and thirty-five sisters.In class three the total of brothers was forty-eight and sisters thirty-one. So we went on round and we found out that there were a few more boys than girls.The avarage number of children was two per family.The most in one family was seven and the least was one.In the larger families there seemed to be more boys than girls.In the families with an only child these were all boys.Some children have larger families because their parents have remarried.
